203.title: Providing that the transfer of development rights are renewable
203.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that transfer of development rights are renewable; making the rights transferred be for twenty years and a reversion of twenty years; and authorizing the county commission to stagger the time rights transferred.

204.title: Prohibiting the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals
204.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals and to only allow fraternal and veterans organizations to renew their licenses for limited video lottery.

205.title: Providing nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education
205.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education through continuing contracts and dismissal for cause.

206.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
206.title: Creating the Traumatic Brain Injury Services Commission
206.description: The purpose of this article is to create a new commission for the service to veterans and others suffering from traumatic brain injuries.

207.title: Exempting acts resulting in the taking or damaging of private property for public use from the immunity granted to a political subdivision
207.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt takings, including regulatory takings, from the immunity granted to a political subdivision.

208.title: Providing for a Public Service Commission investigation for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission
208.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a Public Service Commission investigator for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission and in which an individual suffers severe bodily injury or death.

209.title: Including a tax checkoff option for Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp
209.description: The purpose of this bill is to include on the state personal income tax return a checkoff option to donate some or all of any tax refund to the "Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp  Checkoff Program"   for the operation of the camp.     Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

210.title: Requiring lobbyists and lawyers providing lobbying services to pay service tax
210.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lobbyists and lawyers when performing lobbying services to pay collect consumer sales and service tax.

211.title: Creating multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses
211.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to create multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses in increments of three, five or ten years.  The director is authorized to set fees for the multi-year licenses by legislative rule.

212.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
212.title: Jobs Impact Statement Act
212.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a jobs impact statement to be completed by the West Virginia Development Office for certain proposed legislation which may cause an impact on the West Virginia economy.

213.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
213.title: Providing standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs
213.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs and require hospitals to provide free charity care to uninsured citizens below poverty level and lowered rates to those citizens between one hundred and three hundred percent above poverty level.

214.title: Requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle
214.description: The purpose of this bill is  to requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle .

215.title: Relating to fleeing from a law-enforcement officer
215.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a felony offense for certain persons convicted of fleeing a law-enforcement officer.

216.title: Raising the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines
216.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines.

217.title: Making the senior citizens discount on campground rental fees at state parks available year-round
217.description: The purpose of this bill is to  make the fifty percent discount on campground rental fees at state parks for West Virginia senior citizens available year-round, instead of during the "off-season" only.

218.title: Increasing the amount of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management
218.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the limit of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management from $75,000 to $125,000.

219.title: Providing for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades one through six
219.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades one through six.

220.title: Authorizing county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income
220.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income.

221.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
221.title: Requiring any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program.

222.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
222.title: Removing the exemption from planning and zoning restrictions for mining and manufacturing activities and uses
222.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the zoning exemption regarding existing uses for mining and manufacturing activities.

223.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
223.title: Providing for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff.

224.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
224.title: Relating to the removal of the exemption for government employees performing electrical work on government property from having to possess an electrician's license
224.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the exemption of government employees doing electrical work on government property from having to possess an electrician's license.

225.title: Salary increases for school service employees based upon residential housing costs
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for school service personnel  based upon residential housing costs. The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

226.title: Relating to the employment and compensation of school service personnel
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify when aides should be considered supervisory employees for purposes of receiving pay at a higher pay grade and to provide that classroom aides in kindergarten classrooms which have more pupils than the maximum pupil/teacher ratio receive additional compensation as to professional personnel in said classrooms The bill also creates two new positions for bus drivers and establishes a pay grade for those positions.

227.title: Salary increase for sanitarian employees of the division of health
227.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a 25% across-the-board salary increase for sanitarian employees of the Division of Health to bring their salaries into parity with county sanitarian employee salaries, and to additionally provide for an annual cost-of-living salary increase.

228.title: Prohibiting any person convicted of any felony from voting in an election of state and local officials
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit any person convicted of any felony from voting in a state election.

229.title: Allowing the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a "School Choice Zone"
229.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a School Choice Zone which would enable students residing in the designated area to attend school in a neighboring county if they wish.

230.title: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System and the Teachers Retirement System; and providing a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years.

231.title: Relating to the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support
231.description: The purpose of this bill is to define gross income for purposes of determining child support and to provide that certain employment-related expenses are excluded from gross income.

232.title: Requiring that motor vehicle insurance certificate may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that motor vehicle insurance certificates may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage.

233.title: Allowing the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers' Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)and to specify the cost of the service credit purchased.

234.title: Providing a loan forgiveness program for nurses
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a loan forgiveness program for nurses similar to what currently exists for medical doctors and osteopathic physicians.

235.title: Setting standards for assignment of high school athletic directors
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to set standards for school athletic directors.  The bill also requires a high school to assign a full-time athletic director if the school has thirteen or more varsity sports, and at least a half-time athletic director if the school has twelve or less varsity sports.

236.title: Providing for mandatory sentences for any person who shoots a police officer on duty
236.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mandatory sentence of fifteen years for any person who maliciously shoots a police officer on duty, while providing a mandatory sentence of ten years for any person who unlawfully, but not maliciously, shoots a police officer on duty.

237.title: Authorizing the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists
237.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists.

238.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

239.title: Providing a salary supplement for providers of medicaid eligible services in the public schools
239.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a salary supplement for providers of Medicaid eligible services in the public schools and, additionally, providing the financing therefor.

240.title: Providing that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System.

241.title: Providing for tuition and fee waiver for certain child survivors of domestic violence deaths
241.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide tuition and fee waivers at public institutions of higher education for certain children survivors of domestic violence deaths.

242.title: Providing a one-time bonus payable in July of every year for retired public school teachers and state retirees
242.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time bonus payable in July of every year starting in 2009 for retired public school teachers and state retirees.

243.title: Exempting disabled veterans from campground rental fees during certain times
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt disabled veterans from campground rental fees from the day after Labor day until four days prior to Memorial Day.

244.title: Repealing the Code of West Virginia and adopting in lieu thereof the Code of the Commonwealth of Virginia
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the Code of West Virginia, 1931, as amended, and to adopt in lieu thereof, the Code of the Commonwealth of Virginia. It also provides that constitutional conflicts that may arise by the adoption of said code shall be addressed at the time they are identified.

245.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
245.title: Requiring employers to provide health insurance to employees working on public improvement projects
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that workers on public improvement projects be provided health care insurance as a benefit of employment.

246.title: Reducing state income tax for state correctional officer retirees
246.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state correctional officers' retirement income from the federal adjusted gross income for calculating adjusted gross income for state income tax purposes.

247.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
247.title: Requiring contractors awarded state public works construction projects to meet time restrictions for the completion of a public works construction project
247.description: The purpose of this bill is to  require that each state public works contract include a provision requiring a definitive completion date and that contractors awarded such contracts be required to meet the time restriction.  The bill also defines "public works construction contract" and provides a monetary penalty for failure to complete a public works construction project on the agreed-upon completion date.  It also provides exceptions in which extensions may be granted while providing limitations upon an increase in the contract price or extension of time to complete a project in the event of change orders.  Finally, it directs the Secretary of the Department of Administration to propose legislative rules designed to implement the law.

248.title: Permitting magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit
248.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit.

249.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
249.title: Providing workers' compensation coverage for certain employees who perform duties attendant to racing activities
249.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide workers' compensation coverage for certain employees who perform duties attendant to racing activities.

250.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
250.title: Emergency Contraception Education Act
250.description: The purpose of this bill is to  create an emergency contraception education program within the Department of Health and Human Resources.

251.title: Exempting certain recipients of military medals of valor from special registration plate fees
251.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a "War on Terrorism Service Medal" license plate displaying the "War on Terrorism Service Medal" logo.

252.title: Increasing the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible state employees
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of annual and incremental salary increases for eligible employees from $60 to $100.

253.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
253.title: Relating to treatment of income derived from federal military or federal police pensions that have been converted to federal civil service system pensions
253.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the West Virginia personal income tax to give retirement income derived from military pensions and from federal police pensions that have been converted into federal civil service pensions the same treatment that such income would have received if it had remained military retirement system income or federal police retirement system income.

254.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
254.title: Relating to the definition of "eligible veteran" for certain state training and employment preference benefits
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to include persons who served honorably in the National Guard and reserves as eligible veterans for preference in employment training and employment.

255.title: Relating to the use of personal leave days by a surviving spouse of a deceased employee of a school board
255.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a surviving spouse of an employee of a school board who dies while employed to receive credit for the deceased spouse's accrued and unused personal leave time if the surviving spouse is also an employee of the same school board. In lieu of credit, for personal leave, the surviving spouse may elect to receive a lump sum amount for the accrued and unused sick leave of the deceased spouse.

256.title: Establishing the West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board and requiring accreditation standards for convention and visitors bureaus
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board, establish its duties and responsibilities, and require accreditation standards for convention and visitors bureaus operating in this state.

257.title: Relating to the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony
257.description: The purpose of this bill is the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony.

258.title: Agreement among the states to elect the president by national popular vote
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.  Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all 50 states and the District of Columbia.  The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

259.title: Establishing county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers.  Under the bill, a Child Advocacy Center is a safe place for multidisciplinary members to interview abused and neglected children at the same time.

260.title: Verifying the lawful presence within the United States of any applicant for certain public benefits
260.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state agencies and political subdivisions thereof to verify the lawful presence within the United States of any applicant for certain public benefits.

261.title: Providing that a child born addicted to a controlled substance constitutes child abuse
261.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a child born addicted to a controlled substance constitutes child abuse.

262.title: Providing a tax credit for scholarship donations
262.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for scholarship donations.

263.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
263.title: Prohibiting discrimination based upon age and sexual orientation
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to add "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodations. This bill also adds "age" and "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing.  It also defines "sexual orientation"  as "heterosexuality, bisexuality, homosexuality or gender identity or expression, whether actual or perceived".

264.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
264.title: Relating to parental notification requirements for obtaining abortions by unemancipated minors
264.description: The purpose of this bill is relative to parental involvement in the minor's decision to obtain an abortion.  The bill requires physicians to obtain proof of age prior to the performance of an abortion on a pregnant woman.  The bill provides for a constructive notice to parents of minors, and maintains information for a specified period in the minor's medical file. The bill creates penalties.  The bill also provides for collection of fetal tissue in instances when the minor alleges sexual assault. Finally, the bill mandates specific reporting requirements.

265.title: Relating to child abuse and neglect
265.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit parents, guardians or custodians from allowing sexually violent predators and registered child abusers access to children.  The bill also defines key terms and makes technical changes for purposes of consistency.

266.title: Increasing the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits
266.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits of municipalities from five percent to six percent, with the increase being deposited into the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund for distribution to counties.

267.title: Creating a State Trail Authority within the West Virginia Development Office
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a State Trail Authority.  The bill authorizes the appointment of a Statewide Trail Coordinator and to hire District Trail Coordinators, specifies the powers of the State Trail Authority and sets forth the powers and duties of Statewide Trail Coordinator and District Trail Coordinators.

268.title: Authorizing county commissions to adopt and enforce noise abatement ordinances
268.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to adopt and enforce noise abatement ordinances.

269.title: Providing that adultery shall be a bar to alimony in a divorce proceeding
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that adultery be a bar to receiving alimony in a divorce proceeding.

270.title: Adding one magistrate to Wood County
270.description: The purpose of this bill is to add one magistrate to Wood County.

271.title: Providing for special registration plates bearing the logo, insignia, letters or words demonstrating support for Mountain State University
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for special registration plates bearing the logo, symbol, insignia, letters or words demonstrating association with or support for Mountain State University.

272.title: Allowing a disabled veteran one additional license plate
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow disabled veterans an additional license plate.

273.title: Increasing compensation for conservation officers
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an increase in compensation for conservation officers.

274.title: Establishing a West Virginia State Trooper's Association leave donation program
274.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a leave donation program to allow members of the State Trooper's Association to donate accumulated leave time to the president and designee of the president of the State Trooper's Association.

275.title: Permitting retired state employees to transfer from Medicare to coverage through the West Virginia Public Employees Act
275.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit Medicare-eligible retired employees to transfer coverage from a Medicare-specific plan to coverage directly from the agency.

276.title: Reducing the corporate net income tax rate to five point nine percent effective the first day of July, two thousand nine
276.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the rate of tax on corporate net income to five point nine percent, effective the tax year beginning July 1, 2009.

277.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Act
277.description: The purpose of this bill is to  prevent government sponsored interference with a West Virginian's guaranteed freedom of religion.

278.title: Relating to the licensing of private investigators and security guards
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to strengthen enforcement in the private investigating and security guard field by revising the current law governing the licensing of private investigators and security guards.  It modifies the licensing of private investigators and security guards, with exceptions for federal officers, provides for the registration of private investigative and security guard employees, and provides penalties for late registration and fees and charges for services of the Secretary of State.

279.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
279.title: Exempting all military income from personal income taxes
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all military income from personal income taxes beginning in 2009.

280.title: Giving state institutions of higher education more flexibility in the planning and operation of their schools
280.description: The purpose of this bill is to give state institutions of higher education more flexibility in the planning and operation of their schools.

281.title: Exempting the first twenty thousand dollars of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $20,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

282.title: Permitting the sale of nonintoxicating beer within three hundred feet from a church that consents to the sale
282.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a beer licensee to locate within three hundred feet of a church if agreed to by the church under certain circumstances.

283.title: Allowing pharmacy interns to vend pseudoephedrine and other chemical precursors of methamphetamine
283.description: The purpose of this bill is add language to West Virginia Code §60A-10-3, §60A-10-4, §60A-10-5 and §60A-10-8  to add language specifically allowing pharmacy interns to vend pseudoephedrine and other chemical precursors of methamphetamine.

284.title: Relating to registration and operation of mini trucks
284.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow mini-trucks to be licensed in West Virginia for limited use on public highways.

285.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
285.title: Requiring mine operators to provide notice of hazardous chemical substances and lead exposure to its employees
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mine operators to provide notice of hazardous chemical substances and lead exposure to its employees.

286.title: Providing that accident report forms are conclusive as to the issue of the accident's cause, unless a court rules otherwise
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that accident report forms are conclusive as to the issue of the accident's cause, unless a court rules otherwise.

287.title: Requiring a physician to receive written consent from at least one parent or legal guardian before an abortion is performed on an unemancipated minor
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a physician to receive written consent from at least one parent or legal guardian before an abortion is performed on an unemancipated minor; and provides for a penalty.

288.title: Giving local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel in its jurisdiction
288.description: The purpose of this bill is to give local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel.

289.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
289.title: Establishing the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers and requiring certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers; to require certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States; to establish customer's right to know a customer sales or customer service call center information; and providing a penalty.

290.title: Establishing threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual.

291.title: Extending unemployment compensation benefits when special circumstances exist
291.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the Governor authority to grant an extension for unemployment compensation benefits when special economic circumstances exist.

292.title: Providing that actions in which the state is a party be brought in the county which is affected or related to the controversy
292.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that venue properly lies in Kanawha County in relation to certain controversies involving the state.

293.title: Requiring the Department of Environmental Protection to remediate any waste tire pile in the state consisting of more than twenty-five tires
293.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Department of Environmental Protection to remediate any waste tire pile in the state consisting of twenty-five or more tires.

294.title: Establishing school service personnel class title and pay grade for the positions of "Administrative Assistant" and "Legal Secretary"
294.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the school service personnel class title and pay grade for the positions of "Administrative Assistant" and "Legal Secretary."

295.title: West Virginia Public Employment Relations Act
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the Public Employment Relations Act, designed to require public employers to recognize and engage in collective bargaining with labor unions representing public employees.

296.title: Creating and issuing special registration plates bearing the inscription "In God We Trust"
296.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue a license plate bearing the inscription "In God We Trust."

297.title: Requiring licensed tattoo artist to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the reading of magnetic resonance imaging
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensed tattoo artists to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the clinical reading of magnetic resonance imaging studies, should the medical need for such studies ever arise.

298.title: Relating to the discharging of firearms within a certain distance of a dwelling house
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it lawful for any person to discharge a firearm within five hundred feet of any dwelling house in a safe and accurate manner if that person obtains a permit to do so from the Director of the Division of Natural Resources.

299.title: Permitting county board of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches
299.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county boards of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches. The bill also permits the boards to develop the criteria to be used when hiring and firing coaches.

300.title: Relating to proof of financial responsibility in motor vehicle insurance
300.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the property damage liability limit for motor vehicle insurance to $50,000.

301.title: Allowing guidance counselors to compete equally for all guidance counselor positions
301.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow guidance counselors to compete equally for all guidance counselor positions regardless of whether the position is posted for the elementary grade levels or the secondary grade levels.

302.title: Relating to the valuation of managed timberland
302.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit classification of real property as managed timberland to prevent county property tax revenues from decreasing by more than five percent.

303.title: Relating to assessed property valuations
303.description: The purpose of this bill is to limiting the valuation of any property still owned by the same person or persons who owned the property at the time of the previous periodic valuation, the property's assessed value may not be greater than one and seventy-five thousandths times the previous assessed valuation.

304.title: Pay incentives for teachers who teach in their core field degree
304.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $2,000 pay incentive to teachers who teach in their core field degree.

305.title: Verifiable Science Act
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the public may request and shall receive, access under the state Freedom of Information Act to any purported scientific data used as the basis for proposed legislative rules or statutory enactments.

306.title: Consolidating purchasing by county boards of education
306.description: The purpose of this bill is to consolidate purchasing by county boards of education through the regional education service agency serving their area

307.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
307.title: Prohibiting a business or organization from performing abortions in a public facility
307.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit businesses or organizations from using a public facility to perform abortions; and providing for a penalty.

308.title: Relating to immunity from civil liability for operators of parks and recreation districts
308.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend immunity from civil liability to the operators of parks and recreation districts.

309.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
309.title: Expanding West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program to children of employees whose annual income is twenty-five thousand dollars or less
309.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees and any other person employed in this state whose annual income is $25,000.00 a year or less for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

310.title: Allowing fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal
310.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal.

311.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
311.title: Reporting requirements when it is suspected that a woman suffered injury or death due to induced abortion
311.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to report to the Department of Health and Human Resources when he or she believes that a woman has suffered injury or death due to an induced abortion, to impose duties on the Department of Health and Human Resources regarding these reports and to outline penalties for violations.

312.title: Reducing the wholesale tax on heating fuel, off road fuels, kerosene and propane used for home heating purposes or off road use
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the wholesale tax on heating fuel, off-road fuels, kerosene and propane used for home heating purposes or off road use to 4.85% effective January 1, 2010.

313.title: Increasing compensation of membership of the West Virginia State Police
313.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase compensation for members of the West Virginia State Police.

314.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

315.title: Allowing persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim.

316.title: Preventing insurers from increasing the rates for auto liability or homeowners insurance for persons over the age of sixty-five based solely on their age
316.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent insurers from increasing the rates for coverage of automobile liability insurance and homeowners insurance for persons over the age of sixty-five for the sole reason of a person's age.

317.title: Dedicating a portion of revenue generated from certain severance taxes for the benefit of counties from which the revenue was generated
317.description: The purpose of the bill is to dedicate five percent of current severance taxes imposed on coal, gas and oil, timber, waste coal, and "other" natural resources (such as limestone) to a special fund, to be allocated by the development office to the counties, and the cities within those counties, from which the severance tax on those natural resources are generated at the same percentage as the percentage of the total severance tax revenues are generated from the county.

318.title: "Jason Flatt Act of 2010"
318.description: The purpose of this bill is to require annual suicide prevention training for all teachers and principals.

319.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
319.title: Prohibiting abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion.

320.title: Relating to factors to be considered in granting grandparent visitation
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the grandparent visitation statute to include additional factors for consideration including the child's relationship with the parent contesting grandparent visitation; any history of abuse by the parent, any criminal activity or history on the part of the parent and the amount of time the child spent with the grandparents prior to the absence of contact.

321.title: Providing arresting agency shall pay cost for the initial twenty-four hours of incarceration
321.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the arresting agency pays the cost incurred for the initial  twenty-four  hours of incarceration for each inmate they arrest and incarcerate. Additionally, the bill defines "arresting agency."

322.title: Requiring persons incarcerated for sex offenses to register as such at the time they are incarcerated
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons incarcerated for sex offenses to register as such at the time they are incarcerated.

323.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
323.title: Relating to telephone solicitation of consumers
323.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate unsolicited recorded telephone calls and provide for the establishment of a state "Do-Not-Call" list to protect consumers from telephone solicitors.  This article is new; therefore, strike-throughs and underscoring have been omitted.

324.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
324.title: Relating to the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"
324.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"; to define terms; to prohibit any person from obtaining, selling or receiving a person's telephone record without their consent; and to provide penalties.

325.title: Extending the provisions of the Higher Education Flexibility Act
325.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the provisions of the Higher Education Flexibility Act to institutions of higher education that offer graduate degrees and are not or are no longer administratively linked to another institution of higher education.

326.title: Instituting a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and requiring the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other American historical documents
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to institute a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and require the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other founding American historical documents, including the Bill of Rights, during this week.

327.title: Revising Insurance Commissioner reporting requirements to the Legislature on workers' compensation insurance rules
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for legislative notice by the Insurance Commissioner whenever a rule, policy or guideline that affects the workers compensation insurance system is implemented.

328.title: Abolishing the business and franchise tax
328.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the business franchise tax effective July 1, 2009.

329.title: Prohibiting lottery form using minors in advertising during school hours
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of minors during school time by the lottery for lottery advertisements.

330.title: Exempting from taxation certain property owned by a nonprofit organization
330.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from taxation properties owned by a nonprofit organization which are used for housing college or university students, which is also used for religious or leadership training of college or university students.

331.title: Directing the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary
331.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary; and to require the state board to identify these reports to the Legislature with recommendations on how to alleviate the administrative burden of these reports on principals and teachers.

332.title: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers
332.description: The purpose of this bill is to give retired state personnel and retired teachers a five percent a year increase in retirement benefits over the next 3 years.

333.title: Providing that an applicant for a farm use exemption certificate may not be required to appear before any assessor for renewal
333.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that an applicant for a farm use exemption certificate may not be required to appear before any assessor.

334.title: Creating the felony offense of unlawful possession of cocaine
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the felony offense of possession of one gram or more of cocaine.

335.title: Allowing state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conference for their children
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conferences for their children.

336.title: Requiring background checks on applicants for residence in nursing homes and assisted living residences
336.description: The purpose of this bill is to require background checks on applicants for residence in nursing homes and assisted living residences; and to provide for special arrangements for applicants who are sex offenders or certain convicted felons.

337.title: Relating to privatization contracts
337.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit privatization of government services unless private companies prove that they can perform those services more efficiently than government employees; to provide for State Auditor review of proposed privatization contracts; to list the percentage of each agency's appropriation that is being spent on private contracts in the state budget and disclose this information on the Internet; and to bar business entities bidding on contracts from making campaign contributions to government officials.

338.title: Allowing quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes
338.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes.

339.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
339.title: Prohibiting certain nursing homes from using state funds for activities unrelated to the provision of health care services
339.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain nursing homes from using state funds for activities unrelated to the provision of health care services.  It also requires reporting and establishes civil actions and penalties.

340.title: Providing an election to allow resident homeowners, sixty-five years old or older, to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property
340.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an election for county commissions to allow resident homeowners, who are sixty-five years or older,  to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property during their lifetime.

341.title: Providing a corporate tax credit for qualified health insurance policies
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit  of three one-forth percent against the net corporate income tax for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees. The tax credit would increase by one-forth percent yearly until reaching a maximum of six percent.

342.title: Allowing a public school employee or retiree who missed work as a result of pregnancy to purchase up to one year of service credit in the teachers retirement system
342.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a public school employee or retiree who was forced to miss work as a result of a pregnancy to purchase up to one year of service credit in the Teachers Retirement System.

343.title: Providing a ten percent cap on any increase in assessment of real and personal property in any one year
343.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent cap on any increase in assessment in any one year.

344.title: Relating to discounts at state parks for elderly and disabled persons
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the fifty percent reduction for campground rental fees for elderly and disabled persons at state parks is applicable throughout the year.  Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

345.title: Directing the State Board of Education to develop a program of instruction on macroeconomics
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to help better prepare the youth of West Virginia to succeed in life by providing them with an understanding of the great economic system known as capitalism. This bill would direct the State Board of Education to develop a program of instruction on macroeconomics, the curriculum to include the basic principles of capitalism, the role capitalism played in the founding of our country and the writing of the United States Constitution, and the positive results capitalism has produced in the United States by improving our citizens' quality of life.

346.title: Making changes to the Municipal Home Rule Board
346.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the composition of the Municipal Home Rule Board and change the timetable and responsibilities for the Municipal Home Rule Pilot Program. Strike-throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

347.title: Establishing a corporate tax credit up to fifty percent of the corporation's net income tax for contributions to scholarship funds
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to corporations of up to fifty percent of their primary tax liability for contributing to scholarship funds.

348.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
348.title: Requiring health care providers to release unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing to a parent or legal guardian without written consent from minor
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health care providers to release unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing to a parent or legal guardian without written consent from minor.

349.title: Limiting liability for repair costs to automobile owners when they hit a deer on a public highway
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit costs to automobile owners for repairs needed when they hit a deer on a public highway.

350.title: Granting a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees
350.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees of $5,000 to be paid over a three-year period.

351.title: Relating to persons who do not qualify for professional certificates who are issued certificates to serve in the public schools as athletic coaches
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow   persons employed in the public schools as athletic coaches or other extracurricular activities coaches, but who are not regular professional employees, to continue to be employed in the same position without the position being posted if they have served in the position for three years, receive satisfactory evaluations and are a college graduate, or if the coach is a high school graduate, then the coach shall have served in the position for five years and receive satisfactory evaluations.

352.title: Requiring the Department of Health and Human Resources to maintain information for public dissemination relative to judicial bypasses to the requirement of parental notification relative to abortions performed on minors
352.description: The purpose of this bill  is to  require the Department of Health and Human Resources to maintain information for public dissemination relative to judicial bypasses to the requirement of parental notification relative to abortions performed on minors.

353.title: Increasing the penalty for driving under the influence causing death
353.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalty for driving under the influence causing death from two to ten years to five to fifteen years in prison.

354.title: Explaining all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to clearly explain all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales.

355.title: Making 911 emergency fees available to be used for both emergency and nonemergency calls
355.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter the definition of "county answering point" to mean a facility to which enhanced emergency telephone system calls for a county are initially routed for response, and where county personnel respond to specific requests for emergency or nonemergency service.  This would ensure that county personnel at county answering points also respond to specific requests for nonemergency services (i.e., all calls relating to ambulance, fire, police and emergency services) through the enhanced emergency telephone system. This, in turn, would permit funding of both emergency and nonemergency calls from 911 fees, saving counties money

356.title: Relating to parental notification requirements for abortions performed on unemancipated minors
356.description: The purpose of this bill relates to parental involvement in the minor's decision to obtain an abortion.  The bill requires abortion providers to obtain proof of age prior to the performance of an abortion on a pregnant woman.  The bill provides a judicial bypass.  Abortion providers must provide actual or constructive notice to parents of minors, and maintain certifications of such notice as well as parent's proof of identification for a minimum time period in the medical file of the minor.  The bill creates civil liability, criminal penalties, and mandates certain reporting requirements.

357.title: Changing the PROMISE Scholarship Program to the PROMISE Forgivable Student Loan Program and establishing deferment and forgiveness conditions
357.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the PROMISE Scholarship Program to the PROMISE Forgivable Student Loan Program and to establish deferment and forgiveness conditions.

358.title: Allowing the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a one hundred dollar motor vehicle inspection facility application fee
358.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a fee of $100 to process a motor vehicle inspection facility application.

359.title: Relating to nonpartisan election of justices of the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and circuit court judges
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to elect all justices to the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and all circuit court judges on a nonpartisan basis.

360.title: West Virginia Public School Employment Relations Act
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an orderly process for collective bargaining between school employers and public school employees.

361.title: Requiring accident and sickness insurance providers and HMO's to cover the treatment of Lyme disease
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to require accident and sickness insurance providers and health maintenance organizations to cover certain Lyme Disease treatments.

362.title: Exempting county school boards of education school buses from paying tolls for transit over the West Virginia Turnpike or any parkways authority project
362.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt county boards of education school buses from paying tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike and any parkways authority project.

363.title: Increasing penalties for financial exploitation of an elderly person or incapacitated adult
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for the financial exploitation of elderly persons and incapacitated adults.

364.title: Changing the way that the cost of incarcerating inmates in regional jails is collected
364.description: The purpose of this bill is to relieve the burden imposed on counties of incarcerating inmates in regional jails by changing the way that the cost of incarcerating inmates in regional jails is collected so that it is shared by the county, state and municipality where the alleged criminal act occurred; and making the cost of incarcerating a person for less than twenty-four hours one-half the amount charged for incarcerating an inmate for a full day.

365.title: Establishing criminal penalties for interfering with medical treatment of a railroad employee
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to create criminal penalties for a railroad company or employee who denies, delays or interferes with medical treatment or first aid to a railroad employee injured on the job, or who threatens discipline to an injured employee who requests medical treatment or first aid for a job injury.

366.title: Prohibiting state funding of abortions
366.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit state funding of abortions.

367.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
367.title: Making it illegal to transport a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion without written consent by both parents
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it illegal to transport a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion without written consent by both parents, or the legal guardians of the minor, and providing for a penalty.

368.title: Increasing penalties for failing to report child abuse
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase criminal penalties for failing to report child abuse.

369.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
369.title: Prohibiting school employees from promoting abortion
369.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit all employees of the State Board of Education or any county board from counseling, referring, transporting or assisting any student to obtain an abortion.  The bill provides a violation of its provisions is a misdemeanor.

370.title: Providing discounted motor registration fees for members of volunteer fire departments
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a discounted motor vehicle registration fee to members of volunteer fire departments. Members would receive two years' motor vehicle registration upon payment of a one-year registration fee.

371.title: Waiving tuition and fees for members of the WV State Police
371.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a waiver or reimbursement of tuition and fees for members of the West Virginia State Police attending institutions of higher education.

372.title: Compensating state troopers for call-back time
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to compensate state troopers for off-duty time when they are required to be on standby to be called back to work.

373.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
373.title: Exempting existing churches from paying tax on propane and other forms of heating oil
373.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt existing churches from paying a tax on propane and other heating oils used for the purpose of heating a church building.

374.title: Increasing the pay grade of cafeteria managers
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the pay grade of cafeteria managers.

375.title: Relating to the reduction of state income taxes for certain state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income
375.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the federal gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

376.title: Allowing Class RG and RRG deer stamps to be used to hunt and take antlerless deer
376.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow unused Class RG and RRG deer stamps to be used to hunt and take antlerless deer during the appropriate season.

377.title: Subtracting social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax
377.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

378.title: Providing for aged or disabled farmers to continue to receive the benefit of having their farm land appraised as farm property after they cease farming
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for aged or disabled farmers to continue to receive the benefit of having their farm land appraised as farm property after they cease farming due to age or other disability.

379.title: Permitting members of volunteer fire departments to participate in the state's public employees insurance plan
379.description: This bill permits qualified volunteer firefighters to be covered by the state's public health insurance plan.  The bill also  adds "volunteer firefighter" to the definition of employee and "volunteer fire company" to the definition of employer, and permits the payment of the employer's portion of the costs relating to the plan to be paid from funds available to volunteer fire companies.

380.title: Providing an exemption from estate taxes and the Consumers Sales and Service Tax for certain expenses of any infant who dies before reaching one year of age
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from estate taxes and from the Consumer Sales and Service Tax for certain expenses of any infant who dies before reaching one year of age.

382.title: Modifying the West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority's power to charge tolls and issue bonds
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority's power and authority to charge tolls and issue bonds and to transfer duties and responsibilities of the parkways authority to the Division of Highways.

383.title: Exempting from the sales and use tax special equipment installed in a motor vehicle for the use of a person with physical disabilities
383.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the sales and use tax special equipment installed in a motor vehicle for the use of a person with physical disabilities  and to exclude the value of the equipment when determining the value of the vehicle for imposition of the tax on the privilege of effecting the certification of the title of the vehicle.

384.title: Relating to limitations for certain asbestos exposure claims
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit certain asbestos claims, provide for the fair and efficient judicial consideration of personal injury and wrongful death claims arising out of asbestos or silica exposure, to ensure that individuals who suffer impairment, now or in the future, from illnesses caused by exposure to asbestos or silica, receive compensation for their injuries, and for other purposes.

385.title: Allowing the federal adjusted gross income deduction for the amount spent for medical expenses
385.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow   a federal adjusted gross income     deduction for the amount spent for medical expenses.

386.title: Requiring facilities providing abortions to obtain parental notification or consent in writing
386.description: The purpose of this bill is to require facilities providing abortions to obtain parental notification or consent in writing by the parent or by a notarized signature of the parent; and providing a fine on the first offense of ten times the amount of the abortion and upon a subsequent offense closure of the facility for thirty days.

387.title: Requiring that all state high schools provide a course in archery safety for hunters
387.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all high schools to teach a course in archery safety for hunters.

388.title: Establishing a work program for qualified inmates
388.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program for qualified inmates sentenced to a regional jail facility. It includes provisions specifying minimum requirements for the program.

389.title: Allowing for more teachers to be reimbursed for approved course work
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for more teachers to be reimbursed for approved course work by limiting the amount of course work for which any one teacher may be reimbursed and removing a division between reimbursement for certification renewal and additional endorsement courses of the available funds.

390.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
390.title: Authorizing the Governor to appoint an additional member to the Surface Mine Board that represents the interest of labor
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of appointments to the Surface Mine Board by one member and to require that the additional member is appointed from a list submitted by the major union representing coal miners to represent the view point of the working miners.

391.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses against children
391.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the commissioner of corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses against children.

392.title: Reverting the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to revert the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents while reverting the distribution formula for 911 fees to a pro rata share of total fee revenues.

393.title: Prohibiting the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project which receives any operating or construction moneys from state sources or state taxpayers
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit  the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project which receives any operating or construction moneys from state sources or state taxpayers   for a living, elected official by any governmental entity.  The bill also provides that any responsible governmental official authorizing the naming of a building, road, structure or project for a living elected official is liable to the governmental entity for any costs incurred by a violation.

394.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
394.title: Relating to prohibiting the establishment of new methadone treatment programs
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the establishment of new methadone treatment programs and clinics in this state except for programs and clinics operated by comprehensive community mental health centers and to require all private and community mental health center methadone treatment programs to monitor each patient's pharmacy registry each month in an effort to prevent the practice of doctor-shopping.

395.title: Providing one-time supplements to all annuitants when they reach the age of seventy
395.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a supplement of three percent to be paid to all annuitants of the Public Employees' Retirement and Teachers' Retirement Systems at the time they reach the age of seventy.

396.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
396.title: Defining the term "Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug Plan" in the public employees insurance act
396.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the term "Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug Plan" in the Public Employees Insurance Act.

397.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
397.title: Prohibiting the establishment of methadone treatment programs and clinics except those operated by comprehensive community mental health centers
397.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the Commissioner of Health shall prohibit the establishment of a new methadone treatment program or facility after July 1, 2009, except those established at comprehensive mental health centers.

398.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
398.title: Protecting the privacy of a person's prescription information
398.description: The purpose of the bill is to protect the privacy of a person's prescription information.

399.title: Relating to confidential records
399.description: The purpose of this bill is authorize the chief technology officer to receive confidential records and have access to agencies' databases which may contain confidential information, while accepting the responsibility to safeguard this information as defined by applicable law.

400.title: Eliminating the sales tax on food effective the first day of July, two thousand nine
400.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the sales tax on food beginning July 1, 2009.

401.title: Providing crime watch members coverage under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance health coverage plan
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide health and life insurance coverage for Crime Watch Members.

402.title: Relating to appraisement of estates of deceased persons
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that personal representatives of estates in wrongful death actions need not file appraisements, as the value of the claim is undetermined at the time of appointment; and to provide that such settlements or jury awards are nonprobate assets of an estate.

403.title: Requiring write-in candidates for public office to pay a filing fee
403.description: The purpose of this bill is to require write-in candidates for public office to pay a filing fee for the office sought and to provide for distribution of the fee in the same manner as other candidates.

404.title: Requiring state offices, agencies, boards and commissions to submit annual reports electronically
404.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state offices, agencies, boards and commissions to submit annual reports electronically with electronic copies also submitted to the Legislative Manager in certain circumstances.

405.title: Including roads that serve more than one family in the state road system
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to include roads that serve more than one family in the state road system.

406.title: Expanding the power of municipal parking authority officers
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant parking meter attendants the authority to ticket all parking violations not just tickets for expired meters.

407.title: Reducing recidivism of offenders convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to  reduce recidivism of offenders convicted of driving under the influence of alcohol through mandated participation in the Motor Vehicle Alcohol Test and Lock Program for all offenders.  Implementing mandated license sanctions.  Removes expungement provisions for offenders under twenty-one years of age.  Imposition of staggered sentencing. Offender participation in community corrections programs.  Mandated guilty or nolo contendere plea in pre-trial diversion agreements. Oversight of dedicated drug and alcohol courts.

408.title: Authorizing mixed martial arts competitions
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize mixed martial arts competitions.  The State Athletic Commission has rule-making authority.

409.title: Changing some processes and orders when determining child custody disputes
409.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a misdemeanor and felony penalty if a person fails to make a reasonable, good faith attempt to return a minor child in a timely manner at the expiration of a lawful custody or visitation period.

410.title: Permitting motor vehicle dealers to sell certain motor vehicles on an "as is" basis without a warranty
410.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit licensed dealers of new and used motor vehicles to sell or offer for sale used motor vehicles costing $1,000 or less or having been driven seventy-five thousand or more miles on an "as is" basis and without any warranty, express or implied.  The dealer would be required to post upon the windshield a conspicuous statement that the vehicle is to be sold "as is" and without warranty and the purchaser would be required to execute a statement indicating his or her knowledge of that fact.

411.title: Establishing a lottery scratch-off game for the benefit of West Virginia firefighters
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a lottery scratch-off game for the benefit of West Virginia firefighters for tuition to attend institutions of higher education.

412.title: Providing an exemption from gross income for certain members of volunteer fire departments
412.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow members of volunteer fire departments who have successfully completed required training and who have two years of service to exempt $500 from their gross income, for state personal income tax purposes.

413.title: Giving all school personnel, including teachers and service personnel and retired teachers a raise
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to give all school personnel a six percent salary increase.

414.title: Establishing criminal penalties of not less than two years nor more than ten years for the manufacture, delivery or possession of methamphetamine precursors
414.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish criminal penalties of not less than two years nor more than ten years for the manufacture, delivery or possession of methamphetamine precursors.

415.title: Expanding the powers of the magistrate to prosecute for worthless checks beyond the strict limitations of NSF
415.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the powers of the magistrate to prosecute for worthless checks beyond the strict limitations of NSF.

416.title: Sexually Oriented Businesses Regulation Act
416.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate sexually oriented businesses to promote the morals and general welfare of the citizens of the state.

417.title: Prohibiting elected or appointed officials from using public funds to purchase, distribute or disseminate certain items and publications
417.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit elected or appointed officials from using public funds to purchase, distribute or disseminate certain items and publications.

418.title: Increasing the number of magistrates in Jefferson County by one
418.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of magistrates in Jefferson County by one.

419.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
419.title: Providing a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology
419.description: The purpose of this bill is to  provide a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology.

420.title: Relating to increasing the environmental protection advisory council membership to nine members
420.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the membership of the Environmental Protection Advisory Council from seven to nine members.  Under the bill the new members represent agricultural and forestry interests.  The bill also provides for meetings on the call of members, appointment of technical advisory committees and it specifically allows the council to submit suggestions to the secretary of environmental protection for proposed legislative rules and amendments.

421.title: Eliminating the food tax, increasing the tax on nonintoxicating beer, increasing the cigarette tax, increasing the noncigarette tobacco products tax..etc...
421.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the food tax, increase the tax on nonintoxicating beer per barrel from $5.50 to $6.35, increase the tax on cigarettes to $1.35, increase the tax on noncigarette tobacco products from seven percent to fourteen percent, and to dedicate the first $5 million of revenue to the Department of Agriculture's crop transition program.

422.title: Increasing the amount allocated from the wireless enhanced 911 fee to be deposited into the enhanced 911 wireless tower access assistance fund
422.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the annual allocation of moneys from the wireless enhanced 911 fee to be distributed by the Public Service Commission into the Enhanced 911 Wireless Tower Assistance Fund to subsidize the construction of wireless towers, from $1 million to $2 million.

423.title: Prohibiting magistrates from imposing multiple court cost fees for the same matter
423.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit magistrates from imposing multiple court cost fees for the same matter.

424.title: Including testing for illegal drugs in newborns
424.description: The purpose of this bill is to  expand newborn testing to include testing for illegal drugs in newborns.

425.title: Establishing breeding restrictions for aggressive or vicious dogs
425.description: The purpose of this bill is to  establish breeding restrictions for aggressive or vicious dogs.

426.title: Protecting academic freedom in higher education
426.description: The purpose of this bill is to promote intellectual diversity and academic freedom in institutions of higher education. It protects faculty and students from discrimination resulting from political or religious beliefs.

427.title: Subjecting persons convicted of sexual crimes against a minor to "GPS" monitoring for life
427.description: The purpose of this bill is to subject persons convicted of sexual offenses against minors who are on parole or probation to "GPS" monitoring for the duration of their life.

428.title: Including additional information on the sex offender registry
428.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the inclusion of additional information on the sex offender registry.

429.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
429.title: Relating to exempting physicians from obtaining Medicaid preauthorization for certain medical conditions
